SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.levels

Class LevelParent

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.levels.LevelParent
Direct Known Subclasses:
LevelOne, LevelThree, LevelTwo
public abstract class LevelParent extends Object
Represents the base class for all levels in the game.

Provides core functionalities for managing user planes, enemies, game states, collisions, and UI updates. Specific levels inherit and customize behavior from this class.

  • Constructor Details

    • LevelParent

      public LevelParent(String backgroundImageName, double screenHeight, double screenWidth, int playerInitialHealth, int targetKillCount)
      Constructs a base class for levels in the game.
      Parameters:
      backgroundImageName - Path to the background image resource for the level.
      screenHeight - Height of the game window.
      screenWidth - Width of the game window.
      playerInitialHealth - The starting health of the player's plane.
      targetKillCount - The number of kills required to complete the level.

  • Method Details

    • initializeFriendlyUnits

      protected abstract void initializeFriendlyUnits()
      Initializes the timeline that controls the game loop. The timeline runs indefinitely and invokes the updateScene method at fixed intervals.

    • checkIfGameOver

      protected abstract void checkIfGameOver()
      Abstract method to check game-over conditions (e.g., loss or level completion). Implemented by child classes.

    • spawnEnemyUnits

      protected void spawnEnemyUnits()
      Spawns enemy units using the EnemyManager.

    • instantiateLevelView

      protected abstract LevelView instantiateLevelView()
      Abstract method to instantiate the level-specific UI elements (e.g., health display).
      Returns:
      The level's UI view.

    • initializeScene

      public javafx.scene.Scene initializeScene()
      Configures and initializes the game scene, including the background, friendly units, and input handlers.
      Returns:
      The fully configured game scene.

    • startGame

      public void startGame(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      Starts the game, displaying a countdown overlay before beginning the game loop.
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - The primary game window.

    • playLevelMusic

      protected void playLevelMusic(String musicFilePath)
      Plays the background music for the level.
      Parameters:
      musicFilePath - The file path of the music to play.

    • goToNextLevel

      public void goToNextLevel(LevelParent nextLevel)
      Advances to the next level.
      Parameters:
      nextLevel - The next level to transition to.

    • showErrorDialog

      public void showErrorDialog(String message)
      Displays an error dialog with the specified message.
      Parameters:
      message - The error message to display.

    • getKillCountDisplay

      protected KillCountDisplay getKillCountDisplay()
      Retrieves the kill count display for the level.
      Returns:
      The KillCountDisplay instance used in the level.

    • fireProjectile

      public void fireProjectile()
      Fires a projectile from the user's plane and adds it to the scene.

    • addProjectile

      public void addProjectile(ActiveActorDestructible projectile)
      Adds a projectile to the game scene. This is typically used for projectiles created by power-ups or other game events.
      Parameters:
      projectile - The projectile to add to the scene.

    • addPropertyChangeListener

      public void addPropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener pcl)
      Adds a property change listener to observe changes in the level's state.
      Parameters:
      pcl - The PropertyChangeListener to add.

    • getCurrentNumberOfEnemies

      protected int getCurrentNumberOfEnemies()
      Retrieves the current number of enemies in the game.
      Returns:
      The number of enemy units currently active in the level.

    • showPauseScreen

      public void showPauseScreen()
      Pauses the game and displays the pause menu using the PauseManager.

      powerUp - The power-up to add.
